website_summaries.verdict: Speed through the water comfortably and warm.
pros: Mid-calf leg openings increase kick efficiency while decreasing drag
Those new to triathlons as well as veterans are impressed with the flotation of the fabric as well as its contribution to maintaining form
cons: Possibly too warm for a pool

customer_reviews.title: Engineering Flaws
customer_reviews.text: This suit's velcro collar is flawed. I have a full-suit from blue seventy that doesn't have this problem. The velcro on this suit's collar gets caught in the fabric of lining unless you fasten the collar together when not wearing the suit. This may seem like a small thing, but my suit after wearing it only 4 times is already showing wear on the lining. I swim often, several times a week, so over time this could become an issue.
customer_reviews.author: thunder.cells

customer_reviews.title: NeoSport Tri wetsuit - makes you swim fast(er)
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this on a whim as it was on offer through Amazon's warehouse deals. I'll wear it this summer for a triathlon (and will update my review accordingly) but thus far: - fits like a glove! (check the company's website for sizing not the Amazon sizing chart); - does not smell, despite what others mentioned; - this suit is for longer torso folks; - yes, the neck is a little tight but it's not that uncomfortable, esp. if you only use half the velcrostrip; - felt very light and warm after trying it on (dry) for only 5mins.
customer_reviews.author: Outdoor Girl

customer_reviews.title: Fits tighter that it should
customer_reviews.text: I bought this same suit a few years ago and it fit fine, bought the same size (medium) and this time it was tight around my chest. Thought that since it's the same size from the same manufacturer and I haven't gained weight since then that maybe it would stretch after a few swims. Should've sent it back, swam several times and it's still tight It's a good suit for the price but you should probably order one that's 1 size up.
customer_reviews.author: Ozzie

customer_reviews.title: Great entry level wetsuit for triathletes
customer_reviews.text: This was my second NeoSport sleeveless shorty. I bought one last year when I first started competing in triathlons, and I was really happy with it. But, I've lost a lot of weight, so I had to buy a new one for this year. I was so pleased with my first one, that I didn't even look at others; I just bought a smaller size in what I had. Great cost and nice fit. If you're looking for your first wetsuit and/or you don't want to spend a lot of money, this is a great value. Very happy with it!
customer_reviews.author: Zena Kitty

customer_reviews.title: Good Wet Suit - Happy with product
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this wet suit. I am 6'3" about 240 lbs. the 3XL fits and I am happy with the item. I have used this 3 times now. This is my first wet suit. I am using this to practice and participate in my first Triathlon. Open water swimming Ocean and Lake. Note - for cold water ocean swimming (San Francisco, etc) - you may want sleeves.
customer_reviews.author: Waterman

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: This suit is perfect for anyone who want to get into open water swimming without spending too much money on a expensive suit. This fits tight, however it is not so tight that it will restrict your movement while trying to swim. I have participated in a couple of triathlons with this suit and it helps with warmth and buoyancy without going over the legal limit for a triathlon. I would highly recommend this to anyone who is thinking to start open water swimming, I don't think that you can get a much better than this for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Allen

customer_reviews.title: Different cut but still a decent fit
customer_reviews.text: It feels as if Neosport changed the cut of their suits. This one rubs more along the back of my neck than the previous one I had. I still like the curvy cut of the Neosport and it easy to get on and off. Would still recommend the brand.
customer_reviews.author: Katana73

customer_reviews.title: This wetsuit is a nice quality. I am sensitive to things on my ...
customer_reviews.text: This wetsuit is a nice quality. I am sensitive to things on my neck and the neck was very restrictive for me, to the point I couldn't use it. I am 5'10" and ordered a 14 as recommended for my height. The suit fit me great in height but at 145 lbs had some puckering at the waistline. The suit is cut for a wide hip and not for someone who is tall and slender. The length and ankle opening were nice. I think for someone with the right build this would be a great purchase, it just did not work for my body type.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality Product - twice
customer_reviews.text: I ordered my first wetsuit from NeoSport - it ripped in three places at the first tri I used it. No problem, they sent me a replacement. Then the replacement was defective - in the middle of a race. I've only used the replacement suit twice, the second being an Olympic race. The Zipper broke and I could not get out of the suit. Had to ask for help from a bystander. Ended up tweeking my neck trying to contort my shoulders out of the suit and stay in the race. Very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, excellent price point.
customer_reviews.text: 9/2018: swam in it for the first time, the shorty kept me warm and buoyant yet without overheating. The neck is somewhat tight, and will take some getting used to, but the quality of the suit is quite impressive for the price. There is a small pocket inside wetsuit, perfect for my key (great thinking)
customer_reviews.author: A. Arya

customer_reviews.title: Don't order up a size - fits loose at bottom of weight range
customer_reviews.text: Be sure to order the smallest one that you might fit. I fall between sizes and ordered up. The butt and legs are too loose. Otherwise, I love it. It feels sleek, light and durable. I will probably return for a smaller size.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle F. Smith

customer_reviews.title: An excellent wetsuit in its category
customer_reviews.text: Fits to size and it is easy to put on and remove. The collar is adjustable and fits well thus reducing water leaks. Thicker neoprene panels in front and back are an advantage in open waters. It has large arm openings which are hemmed thus, there is ample room for arms’ movement while reducing chafing. Although the back zipper is heavy duty, it can be pulled up and down with ease.
customer_reviews.author: MB Kayakus americanus

customer_reviews.title: Great suit at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: Great swimming wetsuit at a great price. Very easy to get on and more important, quick and easy to take off. The velcro that holds the zipper tail in place makes it easy to find the zipper. Thank you to other reviewers who mentioned thath this suit runs a little big. I am 5'5 and 128 pounds. I usually wear an 8-10 in swimsuits, but I purchased a 6 in this suit and it is a perfect fit. Don't worry if the collar feels a little tight on land, as soon as you swim the sensation goes away and the suit does a great job of preventing water from coming in.
customer_reviews.author: America V. Oujevolk

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding!
customer_reviews.text: As a long time triathlete this is the third wetsuit I have in my collection. Pulling the legs of a full suit over my ankles had become more frustrating with age and as a decent swimmer the added flotation below the knee just wasn't paying off. I also don't care for arms as they tend to restrict my stroke. Enter NeoSport - easy on/ easy off, excellent flotation and at a price less than one fourth of my full suit. Thrilled with this suit!!
customer_reviews.author: TriShar

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Triathlon!
customer_reviews.text: Love this wetsuit... as a triathlete this suit works perfectly... I have other named brands that were very expensive but I choose this one... comes off fast provides the right amount of buoyancy!!!
customer_reviews.author: Fit at 40

customer_reviews.title: Maybe it just wasn't for me
customer_reviews.text: I gave this a try but I really did not like it. I bought one size above what is recommended; it turned out to be really tight, restrictive, and just not comfortable. I never tried it in the water. Maybe it performs better but I didn't want to risk the return being rejected if I took it for a swim given the price. Q
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: It kept me very buoyant and warm in the cool waters of Lake Michigan
customer_reviews.text: The neck was very tight, and cut into my skin causing causing rash on one side. I had to open the back because I could not breathe properly. I used it for a triathlon, Olympic Distance. It kept me very buoyant and warm in the cool waters of Lake Michigan, but perhaps too buoyant and too warm for an strong, experienced swimmer who usually does not swim in a wetsuit. It fit true to size, but it came up too high on my neck for my preference.
customer_reviews.author: ES

customer_reviews.title: I bought a medium in the Podium and a Large ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought a medium in the Podium and a Large in this one. This one was a little too roomy. I am 5'10" 175lbs with about a 38" chest. Didn't have as tight of fit as I got from the Medium Podium.
customer_reviews.author: J. Baertsch

customer_reviews.title: My husband bought one August 2017 and it is now ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought one August 2017 and it is now splitting in places. He swims most days. However, he likes it otherwise so taking a chance in booking it again hoping it will last longer - especially since the price has gone up a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Marg

customer_reviews.title: Wrong item shipped
customer_reviews.text: This is an updated review as my first order was wrong; fits and looks great I ordered a sleeveless wetsuit, as shown in a size 14 Yet I received a long sleeve wetsuit and the wrong size I am ordering again in the hopes that I get the correct item this time
customer_reviews.author: Happy Camper

customer_reviews.title: Great Wetsuit!
customer_reviews.text: The wetsuit fit fine. First time I wore it was in the Malibu Tri. 1.5K swim in 64 degree water, Sep, 2017. The wetsuit was the right choice for the water temp. Never felt cold. There was no chaffing when I got out of the wetsuit. Time was 22 minutes. Wasn't expecting to come out of the water that fast. Very pleased with the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: OK for the price
customer_reviews.text: My husband purchased this for a few short distance triathlons he's done the past two summers. For the price, it works. I definitely wouldn't purchase this for longer distance triathlons, including an olympic distance. It fits a bit awkwardly and is way too short. My husband is 6 foot 2. He swam in college, so perhaps he is biased about the fit of suits.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole D.

customer_reviews.title: Getting this on/off is nice and easy
customer_reviews.text: First wetsuit I've purchased. Getting this on/off is nice and easy. Love the zipper pull in the back. The neck did come up too high in front - kind of made if hard for me to breathe while swimming. I trimmed it down and it works perfectly now. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Casey Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Good suit
customer_reviews.text: Overall a good suit. I've used it a few times in training and for 3 races. Before my first 70.3 race this last weekend my wife noticed that a seam had torn out across the back. I'm not sure when this happened or what caused it but I was concerned going into the swim, fortunately it caused no problems. Not sure if this is a normal issue with this suit or if I did something wrong. I've had it for over a year which was good but it had been used less than 10 times before the seam tear.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Benson

customer_reviews.title: wetsuit
customer_reviews.text: I swim in outdooor pool, water is about 75, and I am a real wimp re: cold. Air temp in 20's. Fits well, Neck can be adjusted to keep water out. Some water enters at lower arm holes when I extend my reach. My pool is salt water, not chlorine, so no trouble with material. Perfect for me. If you swim in colder water, consider one with arms.
customer_reviews.author: michael k mckinney

customer_reviews.title: A Little Tall
customer_reviews.text: This suit is pretty cool but doesn't come in different heights. It is rather tall for me. A couple of inches too tall, but fits in other ways. If it did come in different heights, I would need a regular, not Tall. But it is good enough for my purpose - swimming in my spring-fed lake in the spring and fall.
customer_reviews.author: MoonDeerSounding

customer_reviews.title: Better than the higher priced!!!
customer_reviews.text: Just perfect!! I had ordered a size larger as many tri west suits are too way to snug to wear comfortably. So, I returned it for a smaller size and it was perfect. More comfortable than higher priced west suits, softer and I love the comfortable piping around the armpits/shoulders. No chafing. Love, love, love!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Laura A. Walls

customer_reviews.title: Not for big guys.
customer_reviews.text: Not for men with an athletic build. This was so tight around my husband's neck that he couldn't zip it all the way up, and he ordered a size larger than was recommended. This is ideal for a slimmer man: good length, easy to zip.
customer_reviews.author: Abby H

customer_reviews.title: 5'2" 117 lbs generally straight build size 6 is perfect. easy to zip out
customer_reviews.text: First wetsuit purchase. I'm nervous about the high neck .might take getting used to swimming in .the fit is exactly right as per other reviews.5'2" 117 lbs generally straight build size 6 is perfect. easy to zip out of
customer_reviews.author: Buffalo Runnergrl

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and easy to get in and out of and ...
customer_reviews.text: Because I swim a lot I have of these over the years .Very comfortable and easy to get in and out of and good neck seal with metalite type material .I wish mfg. would use similar material tab material down the suit underneath zipper .Material there not very durable and does not seal as well as neck with use tends to deteriorate too quickly ,gets rough edges that snag.
customer_reviews.author: WILLIAM KENNEDY

customer_reviews.title: It's a good wet suit
customer_reviews.text: It's a good wet suit, however the wet suit I received did not match the picture. The pictured wet suit I thought I was buying had a no sleeves and a full chest and neck. The wet suit I received just has shoulder straps. It works fine, its just not what I thought I was getting.
customer_reviews.author: Redoak81

customer_reviews.title: Good quality product for cool to chilly temp swims
customer_reviews.text: Good quality product. I only worn it once for a triathlon race without any issues. It gives you good buoyancy and keeps you warm during the swim. Note that I just wish they have half sizes. I'm between their Small and Medium and at the end decided for a Medium. I'm 5'7 and 155 lbs, athletic. But, I half size would have fit me better.
customer_reviews.author: EdAA

customer_reviews.title: nice buoyancy
customer_reviews.text: my first open water swim went well. added buoyancy but not too hot to wear .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great wetsuit!
customer_reviews.text: The large fits me perfectly, I'm 5'11 and 180 lbs. The Neosport sizing chart was accurate. I bought it for Ironman New Orleans, water was 64 degrees and the wetsuit performed great. I love how it keeps my arms free. I had a tiny amount of chafing around the neck.
customer_reviews.author: Cargoplane

customer_reviews.title: This is my first triathlon wetsuit and I am pleased with the value for money
customer_reviews.text: This is my first triathlon wetsuit and I am pleased with the value for money. I have used it in two tri's, and it is holding up. The stitching seems to be coming a bit loose, but I would expect that it should last until I either give up, or start swimming well enough to merit a better wetsuit. I am 5'5" and 140 lbs, and this is a bit tight and long. It comes well below my ankles and convinces me that I could not have order a full body suit. Overall, I am happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Penguin

customer_reviews.title: Wetsuit success
customer_reviews.text: So much better than my old Xterra wetsuit which was really tight and inflexable. This suit goes on easy but you still get a nice snug fit. The higher cut legs make it easy to put on and take off. Provides good boyance and warmth in the water. Everybody liked the look of it too.
customer_reviews.author: Laura R.

customer_reviews.title: I love this suit
customer_reviews.text: I love this suit. It's easy to get on and suctions itself right to me. Because the legs are not ankle length it's easier to get on and off. The neck is a bit tight like others have mentioned but once in the water I don't notice it. I have an xterra which I do not like as much!
customer_reviews.author: SaraR

customer_reviews.title: Served me well in moderately cold water
customer_reviews.text: I used it in the winter season in North Florida for swimming the ocean, and it was enough insulation. Vaseline required around the neck.
customer_reviews.author: Err...

customer_reviews.title: Great Price and Quality
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my first Triathlon. I was surprised by how good the quality was for the price. I like the sleeveless Wetsuit since my arms don't feel restricted.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality for my first tri wet- suit
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality for my first tri wet- suit. I may have gone a size smaller but I think it will work just fine. Then neck is like a mini turtle neck and bugs me some but I got over it when Ii was in the water.
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: 6'1" 250, but XL not enough for 50" chest
customer_reviews.text: My first wet suit order: quality seems very good, but I need a bigger size for my chest/back. I am 6'1" 250lbs with 50" chest and 38 waist. The XL doesn't have a chance across the top: holding it up, the material at the base of the arm holes (widest part) doesn't cover the span between my nipples. The rest of the suit looks fine - hopefully the XXL isn't too long.
customer_reviews.author: MacFamily

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: Great wetsuit. I was worried about it fitting so I followed the sizing chart on the website and it fits perfectly. I am 6'3" 245.
customer_reviews.author: Mikebib

customer_reviews.title: Great fit, quality and value for training and triathlons.
customer_reviews.text: Great fit. An excellent value for the money. I've used it for training in the pool and lake/bay triathlon swims when the water was warm but still wetsuit legal. Just remember to rise it thoroughly after use in the pool.
customer_reviews.author: Da Poppa

customer_reviews.title: Fine, if you have a thin neck
customer_reviews.text: The neck was high and constricting for me; admittedly, I've often had troubles with necklaces not fitting, etc., so it might just be me. But as a triathlon and wetsuit newbie, the pressure on my neck was too much, and I found a better fit with another suit. The return went smoothly, other than the fact that it cost me $15 to ship it back.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Nolan

customer_reviews.title: Great Shorty
customer_reviews.text: Nice shorty. Great for warmer water rather than a full suit. Excellent flotation. Use your chest measurement for sizing. I had to order up a size.
customer_reviews.author: lcb

customer_reviews.title: Fit is good. The quality of the sowing around the arms ...
customer_reviews.text: Fit is good. The quality of the sowing around the arms is questionable. It is starting to unwind already. But not bad. So pretty good suit, on the expensive side.
customer_reviews.author: r benedetto

customer_reviews.title: Great wetsuit. I bought it for a triathlon season
customer_reviews.text: Great wetsuit. I bought it for a triathlon season. The buoyancy is spot on. Definitely snug, but that's how you want it to fit, with that being said it is still pretty easy to get the zipper up and get out of it after swim. No strippers needed!
customer_reviews.author: effie_rocks

customer_reviews.title: A seam ripped after 2 uses
customer_reviews.text: I would suggest looking elsewhere as this wet suit did rip after the first 2 uses. In looking at the seams they seem to not be crafted very well. I would caution against purchasing - you do get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Smith

customer_reviews.title: Worked great!
customer_reviews.text: Wore this for my first Olympic triathlon today and it was perfect. Not too difficult to put on and get off in a hurry. Love the velcrow catch for the zipper pull. Only worn twice so far, but seems to be holding up.
customer_reviews.author: Avid reader

customer_reviews.title: Works well for canyoneering
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for its flexibility and range of motion for rappelling/canyoneering. It can get cut easily on rocks though so one must be aware of too much rubbing in coarser and dryer areas. It has kept me very warm.
customer_reviews.author: Depardieu

customer_reviews.title: No sleeves is a good feature
customer_reviews.text: Fits and I like the sleeveless feature. Wet suits make me feel like I'm trapped in a plastic bag. Without sleeves this feeling doesn't exist.

customer_reviews.title: Best Price and does the job
customer_reviews.text: Only used twice so far for short swims. I was borderline on the fit and went the size up, and its fine. It kept me warm after the first 30 seconds, is easily maneuverable while wearing it. And though I have no experience to tell me otherwise I feel the short version was good for more flexibility while swimming. Cheaper than other wetsuits and did the job.
customer_reviews.author: Richard R. Ambrose II

customer_reviews.title: Ok but it runs big
customer_reviews.text: I'm 6 ft tall and 182 lbs and the wetsuit was a bit on the large side. I would go with a smaller size than "normal".
customer_reviews.author: Luis Pereira

customer_reviews.title: Just be aware that the legs finish just below the knees which is probably a good thing, allowing your feet to stay a bit ...
customer_reviews.text: The suit is a per description, a large fitted me perfectly (Useful when you buy is the US and live in Australia), I am 6 feet tall 34inch waist and 40 inch chest and weigh 74 kilos . Just be aware that the legs finish just below the knees which is probably a good thing, allowing your feet to stay a bit lower in the water for a stronger kick ,as well as making the suit easy to remove
customer_reviews.author: brian taylor

customer_reviews.title: and it was wonderful. They said the water was 66 degrees
customer_reviews.text: I wore this in a sprint triathlon yesterday, and it was wonderful. They said the water was 66 degrees, and the water temp felt perfect with the wetsuit on.
customer_reviews.author: Jeri

customer_reviews.title: Fit was right on
customer_reviews.text: Fit was great. Size chart and information was right on. Would recommend it to all short people that have trouble finding a suit
customer_reviews.author: SarahM

customer_reviews.title: Love the fit of Neosport wetsuits for Athena triathletes.
customer_reviews.text: Was actually a new item with a flaw that was a wrinkle across the chest. Did not effect the use at all. VERY VERY HAPPY with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: orreo5859

customer_reviews.title: Good wetsuit for cool water
customer_reviews.text: My wife likes it. Used in a cool mountain lake with a temp range of 65-70 F.
customer_reviews.author: Ernesto Recardo

customer_reviews.title: Ironman Ready with this baby!
customer_reviews.text: Sizing was perfect per the chart on the manufactures website! Very comfortable and definitely buoyant...I will debut it in Chattanooga half Ironman 5/17/2015!
customer_reviews.author: AmazonReview

customer_reviews.title: Great wet suit for swimming
customer_reviews.text: Top notch. Buoyant. Comfortable. Got the XL for 5'11" 180 lbs. fits right except a bit bulky in the gut. This really makes swimming in cool water a pleasure! I used my previous one a ton until the zipper broke when I forced it. Be a little more careful when it's stuck. It's one of my most valued pieces of sports equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Alex N. Sabo

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: So far the suit has performed well, though as 6'4" 220lb guy I probably would have gone with the XXL. I have noticed some slight tearing on the surface layer in the inner thigh area but nothing that has affected performance. I bought this wetsuit to compete in my first Olympic Distance Triathlon with the swim being in Lake Michigan, and I have used it 5+ times in the lake and it has performed great. I will probably upgrade if I continue to do Triathlons so this was a great price for a starter wetsuit.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan D. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: My wife said it's great for boy ency but tight around the neck area
customer_reviews.text: My wife said it's great for boy ency but tight around the neck area. Overall she was happy I bought it for her.
customer_reviews.author: LRG T

customer_reviews.title: Great Wetsuit for price
customer_reviews.text: Used this wetsuit in triathlon and for training in Lake Michigan. I was able to swim comfortably and was kept warm while in the cold lake water. Fit was good. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: T. Figueroa

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This was a nice suit to use in my tri and helped me stay warm.
customer_reviews.author: S. Eaton

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a good quality product but runs big, ladies.
customer_reviews.author: SCGirl

customer_reviews.title: Sleeveless NRG - Tri apparel
customer_reviews.text: This is a great seller! This is a super entry level sleeveless tri suit. It is easy to take off when getting out of the water. I found that it was a little warm (retains heat) and was sweating quite a bit after my mile swim. Hence, if you are going to swim in water above 68 F degrees, you may want to consider a thinner tri suit. As for cold water swimming, this suit should do the trick and should last some time.
customer_reviews.author: Roberto H. Castro

customer_reviews.title: Great, worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: Great wet suit. Will fit a little tight, which is good. I normally wear a 2x, but ordered a 3x the legs fit a little loose, but the chest is pretty tight.
customer_reviews.author: Thane Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Great buoyancy and warm in cool water
customer_reviews.text: Small fits snugly a 5'6" 140 lb. male. Great buoyancy and warm in cool water. Makes swimming in open water much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Lord Pyron

customer_reviews.title: so so
customer_reviews.text: the fit was spot on, but after just a couple uses, the glue started peeling off making it look cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Forever Yong

customer_reviews.title: Easy to move in and get out of for quick
customer_reviews.text: Fits really well except scratchy at the neck. Bought for triathlon. Easy to move in and get out of for quick transitions
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Webb

customer_reviews.title: Fit well in the body
customer_reviews.text: It has good price, but it does not fit well in the body.
customer_reviews.author: Robson Manoel

customer_reviews.title: Tri Newbie
customer_reviews.text: This will be my first triathlon. I will be doing a 1K ocean swim and was looking for something that would help keep me warm as well as add bouency. The fit and finsish on this suit is great. I have no problem getting it off, esp around the feet. I have worn it on several training swims and practiced transitions and worked flawlessly every time. I couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Joshua Strub

customer_reviews.title: After reviewing a lot of wetsuits and reading reviews-this one ...
customer_reviews.text: After reviewing a lot of wetsuits and reading reviews-this one fit me perfectly! The reviews on this wetsuit really helped. I have larger hips and other wetsuits I have tried this was an issue when putting them on.
customer_reviews.author: Girlly

customer_reviews.title: Works well for swimming in unheated pool
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Very comfortable for long-distance swimming. I have used it in water down to 58 degrees F - arms and head get cold, but the suit does a good job of maintaining core body temperature.
customer_reviews.author: mcmuffin

customer_reviews.title: Great fit, comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Great fit, comfortable, if you are a female with a longer torso, get the men's it will be a much better fit.
customer_reviews.author: Deb W.

customer_reviews.title: I have nothing to compare it too
customer_reviews.text: This product arrived as promised- it fits pretty good- I weigh 220 and wear a 34 inch waist- I am 5'9" I ordered the XL and it fits great. I have only swam in a pool to get used to it before the race next week- I really felt like I was floating on top of the water which is fine by me! Easy on with a little help to tuck cord. Easy off - it all seems good.
customer_reviews.author: S. Cole

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Had to get xx large to fit. I usually order x large
customer_reviews.author: mrguns

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: Well made and designed. Very easy to get out of - key for transitions. The extra front buoyancy is quite noticeable. I haven't yet tested it in really cold water. My previous shorty had sleeves so this one may not be quite as warm.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Primeau

customer_reviews.title: opened at the seams
customer_reviews.text: the wetsuit opened at the seams on the first use.
customer_reviews.author: Victor

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good quality so far. Shipped quicker that estimated when purchased. Good looking suit.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Szabo

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This was exactly what I was looking for. I need an entry level wetsuit for triathlons, I got exactly what I wanted. I'm very happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: MattPorter

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: sending it back -- too small in the chest and too big in the thighs and armpits. go figure!
customer_reviews.author: Karen C. Buroojy

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Wetst For The Money!
customer_reviews.text: I am competing in my first Tri in July, I thought I'd try a wetsuit and found this one very affordable. I have tried it out in our pool a few times and really like the buoyancy it had, made me feel even more comfortable knowing it'll help me stay afloat. I practiced taking it off quickly when exiting the water and had no problem at all, was able to get out of it in about ten seconds. For the money you will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Tbex83

customer_reviews.title: Seams started to open the first use.
customer_reviews.text: Seams started to open the first use. I'm not slim by any means but I have the XL so idk we'll see
customer_reviews.author: Esau Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I expected
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I was expecting. It also fits as expected. I would suggest this for anyone who needs a wet suit for their cold water swim.
customer_reviews.author: Chas

customer_reviews.title: Legs are big.
customer_reviews.text: The fit and finish of the suit was pretty nice, however I found that the legs do not go all the way to the ankles and they are rather large. If you have large calf muscles, it shouldn't be a problem but I'm pretty sure most average build people are going to find the legs fitting pretty loose.
customer_reviews.author: rwrife

customer_reviews.title: Great item!
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't recommend for Scuba use (Armpits exposed) but great for chilly water in pool or Jet Ski use, no arm range of motion restriction.
customer_reviews.author: Carl L. Shanklin

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Size was way smaller than my old Neo sport - same size way different fit.
customer_reviews.author: DF

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Very good product. Good customer serVice. Used for my first triathalon. Water temperature was 65 degrees. Kept me warm. Worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Thomas daquin

customer_reviews.title: Good fit
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this wet suit for a sprint triathlon in a couple of months. I'm 5'9 and a muscular 200 lbs. The xl fits me good but it is a bit tight in chest(I' have a 47"chest, 34"waist)) but I suppose this is expected... better a little tight than too loose. I'm trying to lose another 5 lbs or so by race day. Haven't swam in it yet. Good service and super fast...on my doorstep within 24 hrs!
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Showed up on time and fits great! Great product! I would recommend this product to other tri athlete friends and family.
customer_reviews.author: Frye

customer_reviews.title: Easily tears
customer_reviews.text: I used the suit one time and found a small tear in the suit. Not too happy about that at all.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Junkins

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fits my gf well. A little tight at the neck keeps it from getting 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: James M casilio

customer_reviews.title: Great Tri Wetsuit!
customer_reviews.text: Comfortble, easy to get into and out of, kept me dry and bouyant. Excellent price as well. Great value for money.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Britell

customer_reviews.title: Great product at great price
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for an economical wetsuit option. Was very pleased with this product - used it in a triathlon this weekend. Easy to get on and off and was very flexible in the water. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Brooks

customer_reviews.title: love this, great for the price and keeps me ...
customer_reviews.text: love this, great for the price and keeps me warm and floating! no chafing, sz 6 fit me perfect (5ft6in 130 lb)
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn P

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: Never owned a wet suit. I bought this one because of the price, let me tell you, its awesome to swim in. fits perfect. and I wish I would have bought it sooner... " TWO THUMBS UP"
customer_reviews.author: Michael A. Godfrey

customer_reviews.title: I had it this item for 20 minutes and packed it up to return
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for an inexpensive tri suit and this one fit my needs. I tried the suit on and it fit well (I am 6 ft tall and 200lbs - size 9 wetsuit), but the material felt extremely cheap. I was afraid to pull the suit into place around my shoulders and waist for fear of ripping the suit at the seams. I was positive that in a race situation, I'd rip the wetsuit pulling it off during transition. I immediately returned it to Amazon. I ended up with a second hand, high end Orca suit and it was much better. Remember, there's a reason why this wetsuit is so inexpensive.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: It fits great and performs exactly as needed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for an upcoming sprint race. I'm 6'0" and 210 lbs and got the XL. It fits great and performs exactly as needed. First open water swim was low 60's for a 1/2 mile swim and it performed perfectly. Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Raines

customer_reviews.title: Great suit
customer_reviews.text: It left my arms and chest free to make my strokes, and kept me warm in a freezing lake swim
customer_reviews.author: sub

product_meta.title: NeoSport Mens Podium or Womens Jane Sleeveless Triathlon Wetsuit
product_meta.description: The Sprint triathlon 5/3mm men's john from NeoSport features Speed Skin and ultra-soft coated neoprene for unmatched buoyancy, flexibility, and comfort. 5mm Speed Skin on the chest positions you in the water with less surface resistance. A 3mm back panel enhances range of motion for efficient stroke performance. Large armholes improve swim efficiency, while the arm area is constructed of nylon-laminated neoprene trimmed in Lycra.
feature_bullets: Designed for Performance: Made with an exclusive, super-soft speed skin neoprene material, our wetsuit offers both comfort and buoyancy! Incredibly lightweight and flexible, the sleeveless design provides a full range of motion, enhancing performance.

Long-Lasting Comfort: Featuring an anatomical cut pattern, each wetsuit moves with your body to maximize comfort! Adjustable Velcro collar allows for a perfect fit, and since it’s skin-in and locks out water, it helps prevent scooping.

Need for Speed: Designed with fast transitions in mind, wide mid-calf leg openings reduce heel snag, while easy-out zipper pulls provide ease of use! Triathlon gear features an internal key pocket and tear-away sizing tags for endless convenience.

Premium Quality: A must have triathlon swimsuit works as hard as you do! It’s why we use heavy-duty YKK metal zippers and reinforced spot taping in stress areas. Glued and sewed the seams for extra durability, ensuring reliability and longevity.

Shop Risk Free: NeoSport is staffed by surfers, watermen and adventurers who share a passion for premium design! We’re only happy with our triathlon clothing if you are, each order comes with a 1-year warranty against material defects and workmanship.
TRIATHLON WETSUIT: Designed for flexibility, comfort and buoyancy with speed skin neoprene and ultra soft coated skin material.
ADVANCED TECHNOLOGY: One of NeoSport's most advanced triathlon wetsuits to date, with lightweight Speed Skin neoprene and soft Coated Skin neoprene, provides buoyancy, flexibility, and comfort.
HIGH PERFORMANCE WETSUIT: 5 MM neoprene on chest panel creates ideal positioning in water to reduce drag, and 3 MM back panel permits efficient stroke performance.
SPEED: Mid-calf leg openings increase kick efficiency and decreases drag, and wider exit openings diminish heel snag, speeding up suit removal and transition times.
SUPERIOR DESIGN: Range of motion is improved thanks to strategic placement of three-millimeter, Super Four-Way Stretch neoprene along shoulders and underarms for unrestricted reach.
